intro: Mapania hypolytroides, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and swamps. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. The showy yellow flowers bloom in late spring and are pollinated primarily by insects.
